title: Kamala Harris Launches $50 Million Ad Blitz In US Presidential Race
content: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris launched a $50 million advertising blitz on Tuesday, capitalizing on the momentum of a fledgling campaign against Republican rival Donald Trump with a one-minute spot titled "Fearless."
summary: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris launched a $50 million advertising blitz on Tuesday, capitalizing on the momentum of a fledgling campaign against Republican rival Donald Trump with a one-minute spot titled "Fearless."

title: Israel Assault On Khan Yonuis Killed 300 Since July 22, Says Gaza Agency
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Tuesday that an Israeli operation in and around the territory's second city of Khan Younis killed about 300 people since it began last week, while the army said it had "eliminated 150 terrorists".
summary: Gaza's civil defence agency said Tuesday that an Israeli operation in and around the territory's second city of Khan Younis killed about 300 people since it began last week, while the army said it had "eliminated 150 terrorists".

title: "Sucker Punch": JD Vance On Kamala Harris' Last-Minute Campaign Entry
content: Republican vice presidential candidate J.D. Vance described the last-minute entry of Kamala Harris into the US presidential race as a "sucker punch," according to a recording of his remarks at a fundraiser obtained by The Washington Post.
summary: Republican vice presidential candidate J.D. Vance described the last-minute entry of Kamala Harris into the US presidential race as a "sucker punch," according to a recording of his remarks at a fundraiser obtained by The Washington Post.

title: High-profile Russian Political Prisoners Reported Disappeared
content: At least five Russian political prisoners have been moved from jails and prison colonies in recent days, in an apparently coordinated move that has raised speculation of a possible prisoner exchange.
summary: At least five Russian political prisoners have been moved from jails and prison colonies in recent days, in an apparently coordinated move that has raised speculation of a possible prisoner exchange.

title: UK Cops Question Teen After Deadly Knife Attack Kills 3
content: Flowers, teddy bears and tributes were left near the scene of Monday's stabbing spree at a Taylor Swift-themed dance class in Southport, near Liverpool, that also saw two adults and six children critically injured and three more children hurt.
summary: Flowers, teddy bears and tributes were left near the scene of Monday's stabbing spree at a Taylor Swift-themed dance class in Southport, near Liverpool, that also saw two adults and six children critically injured and three more children hurt.

title: What Are Metacrimes - And How Can We Stop Them?
content: The Apple Vision Pro is the newest tool for Australians to access three-dimensional, immersive online environments, also known as the metaverse. Released in Australia this month, it allows users to take a virtual walk in the savanna from their homes.
summary: The Apple Vision Pro is the newest tool for Australians to access three-dimensional, immersive online environments, also known as the metaverse. Released in Australia this month, it allows users to take a virtual walk in the savanna from their homes.

title: Death Count In UK Knife Stabbing Now 3, 5 Others Critically Injured: Cops
content: The nine-year-old girl died as a result of injuries sustained in the knife attack on Monday, as Merseyside Police also confirmed the two earlier fatalities were girls aged six and seven.
summary: The nine-year-old girl died as a result of injuries sustained in the knife attack on Monday, as Merseyside Police also confirmed the two earlier fatalities were girls aged six and seven.

title: Republicans Call Harris Failed "Border Czar". The Truth Is More Complicated
content: Vice President Kamala Harris, tasked to deal with the root causes of migration from Central America as illegal border crossings were rising in 2021, immediately ran into the enormity of the mission.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, tasked to deal with the root causes of migration from Central America as illegal border crossings were rising in 2021, immediately ran into the enormity of the mission.

title: "I Don't Believe Israel-Hezbollah Fight Inevitable": US Defence Secretary
content: The US defence secretary said on Tuesday he did not believe a fight was inevitable between Hezbollah and Israel though he remained concerned about the potential for escalation after a deadly rocket strike in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
summary: The US defence secretary said on Tuesday he did not believe a fight was inevitable between Hezbollah and Israel though he remained concerned about the potential for escalation after a deadly rocket strike in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.

title: 7 Dead, 3 Missing After Heavy Rain, Floods Hit China: Report
content: China is enduring a summer of extreme weather, with heavy rains battering swathes of the country and many regions enduring sweltering heat waves, is by far the world's largest emitter of the greenhouse gases says scientists.
summary: China is enduring a summer of extreme weather, with heavy rains battering swathes of the country and many regions enduring sweltering heat waves, is by far the world's largest emitter of the greenhouse gases says scientists.

title: British Tourist Mysteriously Dies In Spain, Friends Find Body In Hotel Room
content: He had been on a trip with friends, who left the room around 7 pm on July 16 and returned later to find him unresponsive on the floor.
summary: He had been on a trip with friends, who left the room around 7 pm on July 16 and returned later to find him unresponsive on the floor.

title: Imran Khan Goes To Court Seeking Bail In 12 Cases Liked To May 9 Violence
content: Jailed former prime minister and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf founder Imran Khan has approached an Anti-Terrorism Court here seeking bail in 12 cases linked to last year's May 9 riots, a media report said on Tuesday.
summary: Jailed former prime minister and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf founder Imran Khan has approached an Anti-Terrorism Court here seeking bail in 12 cases linked to last year's May 9 riots, a media report said on Tuesday.

title: 17 Human Skulls In Boxes Unearthed At Suspected Shrine In Uganda: Cops
content: Children foraging for firewood outside Kabanga village near Mpigi town, made the grisly discovery on Monday. Police said residents told officers there were metallic boxes containing what appeared to be skulls buried in a shrine.
summary: Children foraging for firewood outside Kabanga village near Mpigi town, made the grisly discovery on Monday. Police said residents told officers there were metallic boxes containing what appeared to be skulls buried in a shrine.

title: Taliban Cut Ties With Afghan Embassies Loyal To Former Government
content: The Taliban government has severed consular ties with swathes of Afghan embassies in Western countries, Kabul said Tuesday, cutting off diplomats loyal to the former foreign-backed administration.
summary: The Taliban government has severed consular ties with swathes of Afghan embassies in Western countries, Kabul said Tuesday, cutting off diplomats loyal to the former foreign-backed administration.

title: Gizmo, The Dog Who Went Missing In US In 2015, Found Alive After 9 Years
content: A Las Vegas woman has reunited with her pet chihuahua, Gizmo, who went missing nine years ago. The surprise came in the form of an email, sending Judith Monarrez to her knees in tears.
summary: A Las Vegas woman has reunited with her pet chihuahua, Gizmo, who went missing nine years ago. The surprise came in the form of an email, sending Judith Monarrez to her knees in tears.

title: Huw Edwards: Ex-BBC Anchor In Spotlight Over Indecent Child Images
content: Former British TV news presenter Huw Edwards has been chargedwith three counts of making indecent pictures of children.
summary: Former British TV news presenter Huw Edwards has been chargedwith three counts of making indecent pictures of children.

title: Speeding Driver Kills Ecuadorian Politician's Daughter In Front Of Fiance
content: Vanessa Sagnay de la Bastida, daughter of an Ecuadorian politician, was tragically killed by a speeding Mercedes while crossing a road near Wandsworth Bridge in west London.
summary: Vanessa Sagnay de la Bastida, daughter of an Ecuadorian politician, was tragically killed by a speeding Mercedes while crossing a road near Wandsworth Bridge in west London.

title: 1 Dead, Over 140 Fall Sick After Eating Grilled Eel In Japan
content: Grilled eel, or unagi, a popular summer delicacy in Japan, is behind a department store food poisoning incident that has left more than 140 people sick and one dead, the store's president said.
summary: Grilled eel, or unagi, a popular summer delicacy in Japan, is behind a department store food poisoning incident that has left more than 140 people sick and one dead, the store's president said.

title: Did Turkey President 'Slap' Boy Who Didn't Kiss His Hand? Internet Debates

title: Facebook Apologises For Mistakenly Censoring Iconic Photo Of Bleeding Trump
content: Meta's director of public affairs, Dani Lever, clarified the mistake and apologized, stating that fact-checkers had confirmed the original image's accuracy.
summary: Meta's director of public affairs, Dani Lever, clarified the mistake and apologized, stating that fact-checkers had confirmed the original image's accuracy.
